editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Fols. iv-viv blank but for faint pencil notes on v and viv, and on fol. viv ‘Distinctiones Nicolai de Gorrham’, s. xvii.

msItem.author: NICHOLAS GORRAN OP
msItem.title: Distinctiones Theologicae
msItem.incipit: Abeuncium per hunc mundum alii abeunt male
msItem.explicit: preparemus nos ut preparati intremus ad nupcias cum Domino Iesu Christo amen.

msItem.title: An alphabetical index of key words

msItem.note: Unpr., very common in manuscript; Stegmüller, Bibl. 5740; Kaeppeli 3090; Bloomfield 0062.

msItem.title: Themata dominicalia
msItem.incipit: Tabernaculo meo ...; Passionis qualitas in habendo
msItem.explicit: de quibus fit initio isto die.

msItem.title: An alphabetical index of the key words
Parue distincciones
msItem.incipit: Ambulatio. Sicut in corporali ambulacione ita in spirituali
msItem.explicit: hec est uox Domini in magnificencia Petri Ysa. Thess.
msItem.note: Bloomfield 0389, this copy only, attrib. Nicholas Gorran, apparently without warrant. But the work is also in BAV, Pal. lat. 473, fols. 13v-32v (s. xiv), there called ‘De ambulatione spirituali’, and in St Pölten, Diözesanbibl. 91 (s. xv), fols. 93v-101.

msItem.title: Themata for each book of the O. and N.T.
msItem.incipit: Genesis 18 Afferam paxillum ...; Sicut in corporalibus suo modo ista se inuicem consecuntur
msItem.explicit: et sustinentia eorum que ab extrinseco infirmuntur post lapsum suf.
msItem.note: fol. 180v is covered with early pencil notes.
Apparently Stegmüller, Bibl. 11733, citing only Wolfenbüttel, Herzog August Bibl. Aug. Fol. 76. 2 (s. xv), fols. 20–6.

supportDesc.extent:
189 leaves (vi + 183) 230 160
185 125
The edges retrimmed, affecting marginalia, and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: A4(lacks 1), 1–1012, 11–1214, 1310, 1312, 1410; catchwords framed in red; pencilled leaf numbers.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 43 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single small French gothic rotunda bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 1 a 5-line A in colours and gold, with curling vine-leaf foliage and 2-sided border; a ?cat sits on the upper limb (cropped by the binder); red and blue initials with 1-sided borders of the same, flourished in red and violet; red initials flourished in violet, blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs, red highlighting and underlining.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-iii and 181–3 are paper binding-leaves, the two outermost from the same printed book as in MS 45. On the first parchment leaves are the marks of an iron chain-staple at the foredge, near the foot.

history.provenance: Probably made in Paris. It is not known when it entered the College prior to s. xvii.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a table of contents and ‘F. 3, 9’ (canc.), s. xvii, and modern ‘H. 1. 4 (CXLVII)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 63; Powicke, no. 1226; Alexander & Temple, no. 313.
